title-group.article-title: The Business Investment Response to the Domestic Production Activities Deduction

abstract.p: The Domestic Production Activities Deduction is a US federal tax regulation that effectively lowers the corporate income tax rate on domestic manufacturing activities by 3.15%. By exploiting industry level variation in manufacturing activity, this paper analyzes the investment impact of the policy. Results indicate investment responds strongly to the policy â€“ the average publicly traded firm increases investment as a percentage of installed capital by approximately 12% once the deduction is fully implemented. This large response suggests that the Domestic Production Activities Deduction, and more generally a drop in corporate income tax rates, is an investment stimulus policy far superior to other recent corporate tax incentives such as the Bush Tax Cuts and Bonus Depreciation.
